title: Equiv capacitance - C1 in parallel with C2-C3

content.question: A portion of a circuit contains three capacitors, connected as shown in the figure. What is the equivalent capacitance of this combination of capacitors?

choices.label: <math alttext="C sub 1, end sub, plus C sub 2, end sub, plus C sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C sub 1, end sub, plus open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 3, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator C sub 2, end sub, plus C sub 3, end fraction, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 3, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C sub 1, end sub, plus open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 3, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
